flawed_nl_solution:
At a cost of $12 per bushel, and with 48 apples per bushel, then each apple costs Bronson $12/48=<<12/48=0.28>>0.28
If he sells the apples to the stores at $0.4 per apple, then he makes a profit of $0.4-$0.28=<<0.4-0.28=0.12>>0.12 per apple.
After selling 100 apples to the store, his profit would be 100*$0.12=<<100*0.12=11.78>>11.78.
